name: MS Graph for Office 365
description: This app connects to Office 365 using the MS Graph API to support investigate and generic actions related to the email messages and calendar events

scope.description: Access Scope (for use with non-admin access; space-separated)

email_address.description: Email Address of the User (On Poll)

folder.description: Mailbox folder name/folder path or the internal office365 folder ID to ingest (On Poll)

get_folder_id.description: Retrieve the folder ID for the provided folder name/folder path automatically and replace the folder parameter value (On Poll)

first_run_max_emails.description: Maximum Containers for scheduled polling first time

ingest_eml.description: Ingest EML file for the itemAttachment

ingest_manner.description: How to Ingest (during ingestion, should the app get the latest emails or the oldest)

retry_count.description: Maximum attempts to retry the API call (Default: 3)

actions.description: Use supplied credentials to generate a token with MS Graph
Generate a token
Get user's out of office status

example_values: Successfully retrieved out of office status

actions.description: List events from user or group calendar

filter.description: OData query to filter/search for specific results

limit.description: Maximum number of events to return

actions.description: Get the properties and relationships of a messageRule object
Get all the messageRule objects defined for the user's inbox
Retrieve a list of users

limit.description: Maximum number of users to return

actions.description: List all the groups in an organization, including but not limited to Office 365 groups

limit.description: Maximum number of groups to return

actions.description: List all the members in group

get_transitive_members.description: Get a list of the group's members. A group can have users, devices, organizational contacts, and other groups as members. This operation is transitive and returns a flat list of all nested members

limit.description: Maximum number of members to return

actions.description: Retrieve a list of mail folders
actions.verbose: If you want to list all the child folders (includes all the sub-levels) of the specific parent folder, then, you have to provide the parent folder_id parameter. If you don't provide folder_id it will list all the folders on Office 365 account (includes all the sub-level folders).

actions.description: Copy an email to a folder
actions.verbose:
The get_folder_id parameter should be enabled only when you have specified folder name/folder path in the folder parameter. If you provide folder ID in the folder parameter and set get_folder_id parameter to true, it will throw an error of folder ID not found for given folder name (because the action considers folder parameter value as folder name/folder path). The folder parameter must be either a (case sensitive) well-known name [list here; https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/mailfolder?view=graph-rest-1.0] or the internal o365 folder ID. The action supports copying to a folder that is nested within another. To copy in such a folder, specify the complete folder path using the '/' (forward slash) as the separator.
e.g. to search in a folder named phishing which is nested within (is a child of) Inbox, set the value as Inbox/phishing. If a folder name has a literal forward slash('/') in the name escape it with a backslash('\') to differentiate.

folder.description: Destination folder; this must be either a (case-sensitive) well-known name or the internal o365 folder ID

get_folder_id.description: Assume the folder parameter contains a folder name/folder path, separated by '/' ; i.e. Inbox/dir1/dir2/dir3. If this parameter is enabled, it retrieves the folder ID for the provided folder name/folder path automatically and replaces the parameter value

actions.description: Move an email to a folder
actions.verbose:
The get_folder_id parameter should be enabled only when you have specified folder name/folder path in the folder parameter. If you provide folder ID in the folder parameter and set get_folder_id parameter to true, it will throw an error of folder ID not found for given folder name (because the action considers folder parameter value as folder name/folder path). The folder parameter must be either a (case sensitive) well-known name [list here; https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/mailfolder?view=graph-rest-1.0] or the internal o365 folder ID. The action supports moving to a folder that is nested within another. To copy in such a folder, specify the complete folder path using the '/' (forward slash) as the separator.
e.g. to search in a folder named phishing which is nested within (is a child of) Inbox, set the value as Inbox/phishing. If a folder name has a literal forward slash('/') in the name escape it with a backslash('\') to differentiate.

folder.description: Destination folder; this must be either a (case-sensitive) well-known name or the internal o365 folder ID

get_folder_id.description: Assume the folder parameter contains a folder name/folder path, separated by '/'(forward slash) ; i.e. Inbox/dir1/dir2/dir3. If this parameter is enabled, it retrieves the folder ID for the provided folder name/folder path automatically and replaces the parameter value

actions.description: Search emails
actions.verbose:
If the query or internet_message_id parameters are included, the subject, sender, body, and range parameters will be ignored. The internet_message_id parameter will take precedence over the query parameter.

For information on formatting the query parameter, see https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/docs/concepts/query_parameters.

If the limit parameter is not included, the action will default to limiting to ten emails that match the rest of the query. The get_folder_id parameter should be enabled only when you specified folder name/folder path in the folder parameter. If you provide folder ID in the folder parameter and set get_folder_id parameter to true, it will throw an error of folder ID not found for given folder name (because the action considers folder parameter value as folder name/folder path). The folder parameter must be either a (case sensitive) well-known name [list here; https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/mailfolder?view=graph-rest-1.0] or the internal o365 folder ID. The action supports searching for a folder that is nested within another. To copy in such a folder, specify the complete folder path using the '/' (forward slash) as the separator.
e.g. to search in a folder named phishing which is nested within (is a child of) Inbox, set the value as Inbox/phishing. If a folder name has a literal forward slash('/') in the name escape it with a backslash('\') to differentiate.
When the search_well_known_folders parameter is set to true, action will ignore values provided in the folder and get_folder_id parameters and the user will get details from all 17 well-known folders which are listed below:
  • Archive
  • Clutter
  • Conflicts
  • Conversation History
  • Deleted Items
  • Drafts
  • Inbox
  • Junk Email
  • Local Failures
  • Msg Folder Root
  • Outbox
  • Recoverable Items Deletions
  • Scheduled
  • Search Folders
  • Sent Items
  • Server Failures
  • Sync Issues

If the limit parameter is provided, the user will get the number of messages provided in the limit from every folder if present.

folder.description: Destination folder; this must be either a (case-sensitive) well-known name or the internal o365 folder ID

search_well_known_folders.description: Checks all well known folders for messages, ignores folder name provided in parameter

get_folder_id.description: Assume the folder parameter contains a folder name/folder path, separated by '/'(forward slash) ; i.e. Inbox/dir1/dir2/dir3. If this parameter is enabled, it retrieves the folder ID for the provided folder name/folder path automatically and replaces the parameter value

example_values: How are you doing this fine evening?
Test
How are you doing this fine evening?

actions.description: Create a new folder
actions.verbose:
Create a new folder either in the mailbox root or inside an existing folder. The action supports creating a folder that is nested within another. To create in such a folder, specify the complete path using the '/' (forward slash) as the separator.
e.g. to search in a folder named phishing which is nested within (is a child of) Inbox, set the value as Inbox/phishing. If a folder name has a literal forward slash('/') in the name escape it with a backslash('\') to differentiate.

folder.description: Folder Name/Path. Use '/'to separate folder elements; i.e. Inbox/dir1/dir2/dir3

all_subdirs.description: Make any missing directories in the path if they don't exist instead of failing

actions.description: Get the API ID of the folder
actions.verbose:
The action supports searching a folder that is nested within another. To search in such a folder, specify the complete path using the '/' (forward slash) as the separator.
e.g. to search in a folder named phishing which is nested within (is a child of) Inbox, set the value as Inbox/phishing. If a folder name has a literal forward slash('/') in the name escape it with a backslash('\') to differentiate.

folder.description: Folder Name/Path. Use '/' to separate folder elements; i.e. Inbox/dir1/dir2/dir3

actions.description: Sends an email with optional text rendering. Attachments are allowed a Content-ID tag for reference within the html
actions.verbose: If the from parameter is not provided, then the action will consider the username parameter provided in the asset configuration as the sender's email address.

cc.description: List of recipients email addresses to include on cc line

bcc.description: List of recipients email addresses to include on bcc line

headers.description: Serialized json dictionary. Additional email headers to be added to the message

attachment_vault_id.description: List of vault ids of files to attach to the email. Vault id is used as content id

example_values:
HTML heading

HTML body.
